comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Arthur Streeton's "Sydney Harbour" 1907: www.artsender.com/gallery/details.asp?PaintingID=431 The finger of land is Cremorne Point, taken from Curraghbeena Point above Musgrave Street wharf, Mosman.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: And this: Richard Wingfield Stuart - "Sydney Harbour taken from Mossman's Bay" (between 1862 and 189-) nla.gov.au/nla.pic-vn3769442-s22

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Apologies; a better version of the Arthur Streeton picture (National Gallery of Victoria): www.ngv.vic.gov.au/collection/pub/itemDetail?artworkID=21894 The narrow section of Cremorne Point is where Streeton painted "Cremorne Pastoral". collection.artgallery.nsw.gov.au/collection/results.do?vi... And www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/3129029289/

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: From the Powerhouse Museum Tyrrell Collection (Kerry) a later view (St Mary's Cathedral has its towers, and the foreground is built up): www.powerhousemuseum.com/collection/database/?irn=28761

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: An earlier (1893) Arthur Streeton painting, "Rain over Sydney Harbour": artsearch.nga.gov.au/Detail-LRG.cfm?IRN=46512&View=LRG

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Dated 1893 (sheerlegs on Garden Island) - 1895 (lack of Colonial Secretarys Office dome). Similar view and date to Streeton painting "Rain over Sydney Harbour" 1893. which also shows the sheerlegs - artsearch.nga.gov.au/Detail-LRG.cfm?View=LRG&IRN=4651...

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: This 1895 T&CJ article is interesting...the hump in this pic probably obscures any of the larger buildings shown in the T&CJ pics - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article71231345
